meanings.definition: The act of removing color from something.
meanings.sent1: The decolorization of the fabric made it look dull.
meanings.sent2: The decolorization of the painting was done carefully to preserve its original beauty.
meanings.sent3: During the laundry mishap, the decolorization of my favorite shirt turned it into a tie-dye masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The decolorization of the sky at dusk painted a serene picture.
meanings.sent5: The decolorization of the leaves in autumn signaled the arrival of winter.

meanings.definition: The process of making something colorless.
meanings.sent1: The decolorization of the water was necessary for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The decolorization of the liquid changed its appearance completely.
meanings.sent3: The accidental decolorization of the rainbow made it lose its magic.
meanings.sent4: The decolorization of the room gave it a sterile feel.
meanings.sent5: The decolorization of the photo made it look vintage and timeless.
